page.title: 16HOUSING IN SOUTHWELL
page.content: Although there are many older buildings in this area, most of the modern building took place in the 196Os between Kirklington Road and Lower Kirklington Road. Then it went to the other side of the latter road towards the River Greet in the 197Os. The current building estates are on the Newark Road (a continuation of Lower Kirklington Road). Around this area flooding can occur from the river. Development towards Halam was halted by Norwood Park and other land owned by Lord Starkey. In Station Road and Dover Street and the surrounding area, the houses are older and include some terrace houses built around the turn of the century.
